Detailed Description

A Stream way to read primitive data.

All read requests made by calling methods in this class are directly forwarded to the equivalent function of the underlying operating system.

The following example demonstrates how to use this FileInputStream class.

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     gaia::core::Context* context =  new gaia::core::Context(this);
     gaia::base::String fileName("file.txt");
     // Read a file from /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt.
     gaia::storage::FileInputStream* fis = context->openFileInput(fileName);

     // Check this file whether it is available or not.
     if (fis->available()) {
         gaia::base::ByteArray buffer(20);
         if (fis->read(buffer) > 0)
             // ...
     }

     fis->close();
 }

See the sample given above. It reads a file from /data/data/PackageName/files/file.txt by FileInputStream.

See also:
FileOutputStream

Returns an estimated number of bytes that can be read or skipped without blocking for more input.

the estimated number of bytes available.

virtual int32_t gaia::storage::FileInputStream::read ( ) [virtual]

Reads a single byte from this stream and returns it as an integer in the range from 0 to 255.

Returns -1 if the end of this stream has been reached.

Returns:
the byte read or -1 if the end of this stream has been reached.

Implements gaia::storage::InputStream.

Reads bytes from this stream and stores them in the byte array buffer.

Parameters:

Returns:
the number of bytes actually read or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.

virtual int32_t gaia::storage::FileInputStream::read ( const base::ByteArray &  buffer,
int32_t  offset,
int32_t  count 
) [virtual]

Reads at most count bytes from this stream and stores them in the byte array buffer starting at offset.

Parameters:
bufferthe byte array in which to store the bytes read.
offsetthe initial position in buffer to store the bytes read from this stream.
countthe maximum number of bytes to store in buffer.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually read or -1 if the end of the stream has been reached.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.

virtual int64_t gaia::storage::FileInputStream::skip ( int64_t  count) [virtual]

Skips count number of bytes in this stream.

Subsequent read()s will not return these bytes unless reset() is used.

Parameters:
countthe number of bytes to skip.
Returns:
the number of bytes actually skipped.

Reimplemented from gaia::storage::InputStream.
